Title: Infant, childhood, and adolescent auxology
Abstract: © 2019 Elsevier Inc. All rights reserved.Understanding the principles of child growth helps evaluation of an individual child and also what is happening to the health and wellbeing of the child population. The first step is to know how to perform correct measurements on an infant, child, and adolescent, and then use the appropriate growth standard or chart for comparison. Factors such as under- and overnutrition are extremely influential, as are prematurity. Parents’ size, and other medical and environmental factors play an important part, especially on health and sexual development, as do patterns of migration. The correct decision making in an adolescent also depends on incorporating the phase or stage of pubertal development, especially if needing to manipulate growth. Childhood medical treatments may interfere with the natural processes.
